He is considered one of the greatest composers of Western classical music and has been ranked as the greatest composer in Western classical music by many critics. Beethoven's work is based on themes of joy and sorrow, the former expressed mainly in his major choral works. Beethoven's style evolved over time, from his early romantic period to a later period that is often described as 'late Beethoven'. Baroque.passage: Baroque art developed in the 16th and 17th centuries, a period of Western art history known for a highly ornate, stylized form of painting and sculpture. This style was first developed in 1600 by the High Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci, and reached its peak in the 18th century in the works of the sculptor Gianlorenzo Bernini. The main characteristics of Baroque art included an emphasis on grandeur, drama, movement, balance and harmony, with works often displaying a sense of motion. In this style, subjects of great importance were also often represented. The most popular forms in Baroque painting included painting of religious subject matters, the use of fresco and fresco cycles, and portraiture, while some of the most popular forms in sculpture were group of statue, and individual statue. The main styles of painting in the Baroque age of the early 18th century included Rembrandt and the school of Velázquez. There was also an important element of realism which continued on in the art of painters such as Caravaggio, Diego Velázquez, and the school of Francisco de Zurbaran.

Bach created a wealth of sacred and secular music and left a lasting legacy. He produced “musical compositions” for virtually all instruments, which he called the “keyboard orchestra”. They include a unique “universal keyboard composition” style, which still survives in organ music and keyboard works. His most important keyboard works include the 32 Preludes and Fugues, which have influenced countless musicians including Brahms and Debussy.
